title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way to express very large or very small numbers. A number is written in scientific notation when it is represented as a product of a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ and a power of $$10$$.

title: Analyzing the Given Number
text: When converting to scientific notation, identify the significant digits of the number and determine the power of $$10$$ by counting how many places you move the decimal point to get a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$.

title: Identify the Significant Digits
text: What are the significant digits of 7,158,000,000? Provide your answer in the form of a decimal between $$1$$ and $$10$$.

title: Determine the Power of $$10$$
text: To find the power of $$10$$, count the number of places you need to move the decimal point to turn the number into its significant digits form $$(7.158)$$. This provides the exponent for the power of $$10$$.

title: Count the Decimal Places
text: How many places will the decimal point move to the left to convert 7,158,000,000 to $$7.158$$?

title: Form the Scientific Notation
text: Combine the significant digits with the power of $$10$$ calculated using the format $$a {10}^n$$, where 'a' is the significant digits and 'n' is the power of $$10$$.

title: Write in Scientific Notation
text: Combine the significant digits and the power of $$10$$ to express 7,158,000,000 in scientific notation.
